channel.title: Borderlands: The Pre Sequel
channel.description:
Who has it? Can't wait to play through the story.
Wilhelm + Athena seem like cool characters to play.

item.title: Borderlands: The Pre Sequel
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“Ryan`, post:12, topic:547382”][quote author=nolan2131 link=topic=666288.msg4454739#msg4454739 date=1413949002]

i don’t completely agree with the idea that it should have been a DLC; there is a lot going on and i found it to be a good lead in to the events of BL2. sure, there a multiple bugs and glitches (items going under ground, into walls, etc) and the moon buggy is the glitchiest vehicle ever, but it’s still fun. they should have also released with more end game content.

@cryo: it’s much more useful than slag ever was in bl2.

You weren’t using slag correctly my friend.
[/quote]cryo can lead to a near instant kill a vast majority of the time whereas slag had to be used in conjunction with another element type to be useful.[/quote]

Unkempt, Sandhawk, Interfacer + Magic Misslex4, or Slagged Rubi lead to a near instant kill a vast majority of the time on most major raid bosses. Yeah it had to be used in conjunction with another elemental type/non but it never was an inconvenience.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Still need to finish BL 1 and 2 before I can be bothered to get the pre-sequel, but I’ve put several hours into both of those playing co-op not paying attention to the story, with one of my friends who is a BL fanatic, and ever since it came out it’s what he’s always on steam playing when he’s not at work. So I must only assume it’s just as good as the first two.

item.title: Borderlands: The Pre Sequel
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

I have a level 28 Nisha. Not going to lie, I’m really disappointed compared to BL1 and BL2. At the midnight release it didn’t even keep me interested past 3am. I don’t know if it’s because they took so little time to develop the game (less than 2 years as opposed to over 4 with BL2), the outsourced company working on the game, or what, but it’s very… glitched at some points (objectives, way points, character interaction, etc…) and the story doesn’t tie in well for a “pre-sequal” like I hoped it would, they’re some conflicting ideologies in the story line if you dissect it. Even IGN rated the game an 8.0, which isn’t bad, but compared to BL1 with an 8.8 and BL2 with a 9.0, that’s pretty disappointing. The mapping and color scheme is also something they’ve returned to their BL1 roots upon, they’re all desolate and bland. BL2 had the best maps out of the three games by far; and I understand that they have the moon to work with so there are limitations, but still… The ice weaponry is stupid, dumb element to add IMO. I like laser weaponry, the characters, player movement, and that’s about it so far. The story isn’t impressing me as a whole. It should’ve been condensed into a BL2 add-on DLC. Just my opinion, I’m passionate about this series since they’re my favorite so I tend to be very critical and bias.

@Eddie, BL2 is fantastic once you get into it.

Read full topic

item.description:

borderlands 2 was bought by baddy351 for me and I just don’t like the style of it. Looks too futuristic for my game desires. About the only thing I like about it is how all the art is personally drawn from what I was told.

item.title: Borderlands: The Pre Sequel
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

HcoJustin:

I made it a few hours into the story and lost interest. Story wise it is just as great as all of the previous games. But also like the other games, solo play is painful. You definitely need friends to enjoy it with

I always go through the 1st playthrough on my own so I can get the whole story without distractions. After that, it’s always co-op!

Ryan`:

i’ve got a good 53 hours in the game so far, now i just want people to co-op with.

Sweet! How did you enjoy the story? I just started it.

Read full topic
